1.comment: Ronnie Brown couldn't do anything against the Jets' defense. Williams collected 24 yards on 10 carries, and fumbled twice. Brown had 6 rushes for 23 yards.    I normally don't mention punters in my write-up, but

2.comment: Ronnie Brown battle once again was a wash. Both carried the ball 11 times. Williams had 28 yards, while Brown had 25 yards and a score. I have to wonder why Miami's supposed improved offensive line can't help either back run for more than 2.5 yards per rush.

3.comment: Ronnie Brown and Ricky Williams combined for 211 yards and 4 rushing touchdowns.

4.comment: Ronnie Brown was once again unstoppable; he gained 125 yards on 24 carries. One has to wonder what the Dolphins will do when (not if) Brown goes down with his annual injury.    Brown didn't throw any passes this time.

5.comment: Ronnie Brown was once again unstoppable; he gained 125 yards on 24 carries. One has to wonder what the Dolphins will do when (not if) Brown goes down with his annual injury.    Brown didn't throw any passes this time.

6.comment: Ronnie Brown didn't put up monstrous numbers (50 yards), but he carried the ball just 13 times and he scored a touchdown as well.

7.comment: Ronnie Brown was held to just 27 yards on 13 rushes.

8.comment: Ronnie Brown managed 43 yards on 14 carries.

9.comment: Ronnie Brown gained just 59 yards and a touchdown on 20 carries versus Denver's 31st-ranked rush defense. Most of Brown's yardage came on a 30-yard run.

10.comment: Ronnie Brown totaled 93 rushing yards on 21 carries.    Luckily for the Dolphins, they were playing a quarterback who had an even worse YPA. Not that Miami could stop him.

11.comment: Ronnie Brown did so out of the Wildcat formation in Week 3.    Another rookie,

12.comment: Ronnie Brown gained 101 yards on 16 rushes, while Ricky Williams managed 49 yards on 13 attempts.

13.comment: Ronnie Brown and Ricky Williams didn't manage much on the ground.

14.comment: Ronnie Brown compiled just 48 yards and a score on 15 carries.

15.comment: Ronnie Brown rushed for 70 yards on 16 carries.

16.comment: Ronnie Brown and Ricky Williams pretty much split carries, for some reason.

17.comment: Ronnie Brown failed to eclipse the 35-yard rushing barrier.

18.comment: Ronnie Brown combined for 107 yards on 21 carries.    Meanwhile,

19.comment: Ronnie Brown run. Pat White, meanwhile ran for no gain and was incomplete on 1 attempt, missing an open Ted Ginn downfield.    As for Miami's regular offense, the 7 points it put up pretty much speaks for itself. The score could have been a lot closer, but Anthony Fasano fumbled the ball away at the Atlanta 10. In total, the Dolphins had 4 turnovers after coming up with a plus-17 turnover differential last year - a sign that things won't be the same in 2009.    Chad Pennington was 21-of-29, but threw for just 176 yards, which gives him a pretty weak YPA of 6.1. Pennington also had a touchdown and an interception.    Perhaps Miami's greatest mistake was not getting Ronnie Brown involved enough. Despite the fact that Brown averaged 4.3 yards per carry against Atlanta's pedestrian run defense, Brown was given only 10 carries. He also had just 3 receptions for 10 more yards. I understand being scared of Brown wearing down late in the year, but with games coming up against Indianapolis and San Diego, this was 1 the Dolphins had to have.    Another concern the Dolphins suddenly have is pass protection; the Falcons, not known for being able to get after the quarterback consistently, managed 4 sacks on Pennington.

20.comment: Ronnie Brown was really effective early, gaining 75 yards on 18 carries.

21.comment: Ronnie Brown was really effective early, gaining 75 yards on 18 carries.

22.comment: Ronnie Brown burst through Buffalo's defense for 115 yards and 2 touchdowns on 20 carries.

23.comment: Ronnie Brown mustered 48 yards and a score on 16 attempts.

24.comment: Ronnie Brown and Ricky Williams had 27 yards each on 11 and 8 carries, respectively.

25.comment: Ronnie Brown, meanwhile, tossed a touchdown to Joey Haynos Crime.

26.comment: Ronnie Brown (12). Williams also out-gained Brown, 102-82. Brown caught the touchdown, but he left the game in the third quarter with an ankle injury and didn't return. He'll probably be out Thursday.

27.comment: Ronnie Brown had 65 yards and a touchdown on 13 carries, while Ricky Williams totaled 62 yards on 18 attempts.

28.comment: Ronnie Brown and Ricky Williams totaled 110 yards on 23 carries.

30.comment: Ronnie Brown (19-73) and Ricky Williams (13-64) could not be stopped, as Miami's offensive line pushed Green Bay's front around all afternoon.

31.comment: Ronnie Brown couldn't do anything (9-14). At 1 point, Miami inexplicably opted to run the ball in a short-yardage situation with Brown over

32.comment: Ronnie Brown drop) and poor play-calling (short pass on 3rd-and-8; run on 3rd-and-6). However, Carpenter was able to salvage this victory on a 5-of-5 afternoon, including a 54-yard bomb.    Miami's offense was solid otherwise, generating 354 net yards.

33.comment: Ronnie Brown (9-59, TD) was effective. I'll never understand why

34.comment: Ronnie Brown had just 11 yards on 12 carries, but saved his fantasy day with a touchdown.

35.comment: Ronnie Brown (24-85) completely gashed Oakland on the ground.    Bruce Gradkowski, meanwhile, didn't play so well. He went 17-of-32 for 252 yards, 1 touchdown and 2 interceptions. It appears as though the magic he had at the end of last year has fizzled out. Of course, Gradkowski didn't have much of a chance because of an anemic ground attack.

36.comment: Ronnie Brown (16-50) and Ricky Williams (10-48) at least ran well - offensive coordinator Dan Henning called a rushing play on 3rd-and-8 near midfield in the third quarter of a tie game.

37.comment: Ronnie Brown (16-55) and Ricky Williams (10-34) did enough on offense to win the game.

38.comment: Ronnie Brown (10-39, TD) and Ricky Williams (7-19) couldn't find any running room.

39.comment: Ronnie Brown needed 30 rushing yards to reach 750 on the season. Why is this significant? Brown was due $500,000 if he could reach that benchmark. Unfortunately for Brown's wallet, he had just 14 yards on 6 carries. I'll have more on this in the tomorrow.

40.comment: Ronnie Brown (4-7) didn't see much action - obviously a major disappointment to the 1 person on this planet who thought the Eagles would utilize a 2.back offense.

41.comment: Ronnie Brown in the second quarter. He was trying to find the end zone on an inside run from the San Francisco 1-yard line. After realizing he would not make it, something froze his brain, prompting a backward pass attempt. He failed according to the refs, and it was ruled a fumble. The turnover basically took 3 points off the board, assuming they attempted and converted an easy field goal from about the 3. After driving the field at will, Philadelphia led only 20-3 at halftime, but should have been up by much more. The 49ers found some offense to start the second half only to watch

42.comment: Ronnie Brown get touches on the final drive.    As for the Saints, Henderson (8-123) had a breakout performance, which included the record-setting score, but it was

43.comment: Ronnie Brown, who snagged 7 balls for 85 yards.    Only 3 non-running backs on the Chargers caught passes. They were

44.comment: Ronnie Brown (5-31) didn't do much outside of third-down situations despite speculation that he would. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

45.comment: Ronnie Brown in the third quarter, but he did get some opportunities as the Chargers were trying to bleed the clock, but the aforementioned hold prevented him from being able to clinch the victory.

46.comment: Ronnie Brown, they moved it into range for Nick Novak, who converted to keep the season alive. San Diego, now 9-6, still needs some help to earn 1 of the 2 wild-card spots, but at least it has a chance.    Rivers finished 33-of-54 for 356 yards, 4 touchdowns and 3 interceptions. It was ugly early; Rivers' first pick wasn't too bad, as Perrish Cox had great coverage, but his next 1 was returned for 6. as it was heaved right to Antoine Bethea. Rivers' third interception came after halftime; it was a high throw that occurred because he couldn't step into his throw. As mentioned though, Rivers caught fire at the very end to help his team's hopes alive.    Rivers' main targets were Royal (10-94, TD) and Antonio Gates, who had 7 catches for 92 yards and 2 touchdowns. Floyd (4-50) secured the 4.h score. Meanwhile, someone named Dontrelle Inman, who had never caught a pass in the NFL prior to Saturday night, logged 7 receptions for 79 yards, stepping in for an injured Keenan Allen, as well as an ineffective Seyi Ajirotutu following halftime. Inman's numbers included a key grab on 4.h-and-10 of the final drive of regulation. He's worth picking up in dynasty formats.    With Ryan Mathews out, the Chargers utilized a 3.headed platoon at running back, with Branden Oliver leading the way. He paced the team in rushing with 53 yards on 13 carries and also had 3 catches for 28 receiving yards. He had some nice spurts where he avoided 49er defenders, but the Chargers went with Ronnie Brown (7-33) when the game was on the line.
